greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerator of r(n) = Sum(e/p: n=Product(p^e)).
comment: The fraction a(n)/A083346(n) is totally additive with a(p) = 1/p. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, May 17 2006
Least common multiple of n and its arithmetic derivative, divided by n, i.e. a(n) = lcm(n,n')/n = A086130(n)/A000027(n). - _Giorgio Balzarotti_, Apr 14 2011
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
maple: numer(add(a[k][2]/a[k][1],k=1..nops(a))); end: seq(P(i),i=1..85); # _Paolo P. Lava_, Oct 17 2018
mathematica: Array[Numerator@ Total[FactorInteger[#] /. {p_, e_} /; e > 0 :> e/p] - Boole[# == 1] &, 85] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Feb 25 2018 *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 25 2003
